resources.string:
• 1.5 qt pot (for 10 bottles worth)
• large tea infuser (3in)
• ladle spoon
• clean food scissors
• 2G glass or ceramic dispenser
• mesh cloth or t-shirt
• rubber band or lid
• thermometer
• jar with lid (for SCOBY hotel)
• distilled vinegar

• black tea 
• raw cane sugar 
• spring water 
• active Kombucha 
• Kombucha mushroom culture

1) rinse out Kombucha vessel and pot with distilled vinegar
2) boil water in pot 
3) add tea and turn off heat
4) add raw cane sugar, stir until dissolved
5) let steep until cool with lid on
6) strain tea into bowl
7) add active Kombucha liquid [add full 16 oz of kombucha if you do not have a mushroom culture already, leave ½ inch at top of the jar for culture to grow]
8) place in gallon ceramic/glass jar
9) add the mother mushroom w/ opaque side up
10) cover with a mesh cloth, other cloth, or loose lid
11) store on a countertop or in a cupboard space that is no warmer than 77º [the cooler the temperature the longer it takes to culture]

1) estimate 5-10 days [sometimes it takes 14 days]
2) taste: too sweet = it has not completely fermented 
 too vinegary or sour = it has gone too long 
3) bottle separately and let sit @ room temperature for 2 days, then refrigerate
